verses.text: And Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that \add they\add* should come to the house of the \sc Lord\sc* at Jerusalem, to keep the passover unto the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel.
For the king had taken counsel, and his princes, and all the congregation in Jerusalem, to keep the passover in the second month.
For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.
And the thing pleased the king and all the congregation.

So they established a decree to make proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beer-sheba even to Dan, that \add they\add* should come to keep the passover unto the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel at Jerusalem: for they had not done \add it\add* of a long \add time in such sort\add* as it was written.

So the posts went with the letters from the king and his princes throughout all Israel and Judah, and according to the commandment of the king, saying, Ye children of Israel, turn again unto the \sc Lord\sc* God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and he will return to the remnant of you, that are escaped out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.
And be not ye like your fathers, and like your brethren, which trespassed against the \sc Lord\sc* God of their fathers, \add who\add* therefore gave them up to desolation, as ye see.

Now be ye not stiffnecked, as your fathers \add were, but\add* yield yourselves unto the \sc Lord\sc*, and enter into his sanctuary, which he hath sanctified for ever: and serve the \sc Lord\sc* your God, that the fierceness of his wrath may turn away from you.

For if ye turn again unto the \sc Lord\sc*, your brethren and your children \add shall find\add* compassion before them that lead them captive, so that \add they shall\add* come again into this land: for the \sc Lord\sc* your God \add is\add* gracious and merciful, and will not turn away \add his\add* face from you, if ye return unto him.
So the posts passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh even unto Zebulun: but they laughed them to scorn, and mocked them.
Nevertheless divers of Asher and Manasseh and of Zebulun humbled themselves, and came to Jerusalem.
Also in Judah the hand of God was to give them one heart to do the commandment of the king and of the princes, by the word of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And there assembled \add at\add* Jerusalem much people to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great congregation.
And they arose and took away the altars that \add were\add* in Jerusalem, and all the altars for incense took they away, and cast \add them\add* into the brook Kidron.

Then they killed the passover on the fourteenth \add day\add* of the second month: and the priests and the Levites were ashamed, and sanctified themselves, and brought in the burnt offerings \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And they stood in their place after their manner, according to the law of Moses the man of God: the priests sprinkled the blood, \add which they received\add* of the hand of the Levites.

For \add there were\add* many in the congregation that were not sanctified: therefore the Levites had the charge of the killing of the passovers for every one \add that was\add* not clean, to sanctify \add them\add* unto the \sc Lord\sc*.

For a multitude of the people, \add even\add* many of Ephraim, and Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet did they eat the passover otherwise than it was written. But Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, The good \sc Lord\sc* pardon every one
\add that\add* prepareth his heart to seek God, the \sc Lord\sc* God of his fathers, though \add he be\add* not \add cleansed\add* according to the purification of the sanctuary.
And the \sc Lord\sc* hearkened to Hezekiah, and healed the people.

And the children of Israel that were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness: and the Levites and the priests praised the \sc Lord\sc* day by day, \add singing\add* with loud instruments unto the \sc Lord\sc*.

And Hezekiah spake comfortably unto all the Levites that taught the good knowledge of the \sc Lord\sc*: and they did eat throughout the feast seven days, offering peace offerings, and making confession to the \sc Lord\sc* God of their fathers.
And the whole assembly took counsel to keep other seven days: and they kept \add other\add* seven days \add with\add* gladness.

For Hezekiah king of Judah did give to the congregation a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep; and the princes gave to the congregation a thousand bullocks and ten thousand sheep: and a great number of priests sanctified themselves.

And all the congregation of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and all the congregation that came out of Israel, and the strangers that came out of the land of Israel, and that dwelt in Judah, rejoiced.
So there was great joy in Jerusalem: for since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel \add there was\add* not the like in Jerusalem.
Then the priests the Levites arose and blessed the people: and their voice was heard, and their prayer came \add up\add* to his holy dwelling place, \add even\add* unto heaven.
